TITLE: Can K-Pop Make the Metaverse Cool?
SUMMARY: In the world’s testing ground for tech, K-pop singers are being spun up out of pixels and doing battle in a virtual universe.

TITLE: Netherlands and Japan Said to Join U.S. in Curbing China’s Access to Chip Tech
SUMMARY: A new agreement is expected to expand the reach of U.S. technology restrictions on China issued last year.

TITLE: The Week in Business: Creeping Layoffs
SUMMARY: Data shows that the U.S. economy has been largely resilient. The Fed may slow its rate increases. And the jobs report is expected to show solid gains.

TITLE: How a Drug Company Made $114 Billion by Gaming the U.S. Patent System
SUMMARY: AbbVie for years delayed competition for its blockbuster drug Humira, at the expense of patients and taxpayers. The monopoly is about to end.

TITLE: When Private Equity Came for the Toddler Gyms
SUMMARY: The same playbook that has notched high returns acquiring things like foreclosed homes and highway rest stops is being tested by a family-oriented franchise.

TITLE: A Florida Judge Finds a New Job: Defending an Inmate
SUMMARY: In a coda to the wrongful-conviction podcast “Bone Valley,” Judge Scott Cupp says he’ll step down to spring a man serving a life sentence for murder.

TITLE: What’s Passive Income? It’s Not What Influencers Say It Is.
SUMMARY: Misconceptions about passive income abound, namely that it’s easy to earn.

TITLE: Easy to Use, Mobile Payment Apps Are Also Easy to Misuse
SUMMARY: While they have taken steps to help prevent mishaps, a new report finds they offer few protections if, for instance, users accidentally send money to the wrong person.

TITLE: British Airline, Flybe, Collapses a Second Time
SUMMARY: Flybe, once the largest independent regional airline in Europe, canceled all flights on Saturday. A new owner failed to save the carrier, which was already struggling when the pandemic hit.

TITLE: His Boating App Needed a Boost. His Daughter’s TikTok Audience Came Through.
SUMMARY: Jeff Foulk spent years working on Argo Navigation, a GPS app for boats. After a TikTok video, it became one of the App Store’s most popular products.

TITLE: ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ Is the Victim of its Own Success
SUMMARY: What once seemed like attractive economics have been upended by increasing competition and rising interest rates.

TITLE: Sam Bankman-Fried’s Prosecutors Ask Judge to Tighten Bail Conditions
SUMMARY: The move followed the disgraced cryptocurrency executive’s attempt to contact a potential witness in his criminal case, prosecutors said.

TITLE: China’s Oil and Gas Use Fell in 2022 for First Time in Decades
SUMMARY: Pandemic lockdowns curbed Chinese energy demand, but the International Energy Agency expects a rebound this year.

TITLE: Anthropic Said to Be Closing In on $300 Million in New A.I. Funding
SUMMARY: Anthropic specializes in generative artificial intelligence, a hot investment in Silicon Valley. The new funding could value the company at roughly $5 billion.

TITLE: Gautam Adani’s Conglomerate Shaken by Stock Market Rout
SUMMARY: The Adani Group, founded by Gautam Adani, Asia’s richest person, has lost $50 billion in value this week as it rebutted a critical report from a New York investment firm.

TITLE: ‘GMA3’ Co-Anchors T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach to Leave ABC After Scandal
SUMMARY: T.J. Holmes and Amy Robach, who co-hosted “GMA3,” were both married when they began a romantic relationship.

TITLE: Goldman Sachs Cuts C.E.O. David Solomon’s Pay After Bank’s Poor Performance
SUMMARY: David M. Solomon earned $25 million in 2022, still a hefty sum but nearly 30 percent lower than a year earlier.

TITLE: Your Investment Lost Money Last Year. So Why the Big Tax Bill?
SUMMARY: When you invest and where matters for taxes. But a few rules of thumb can stave off some nasty surprises, our columnist says.

TITLE: Consumer Spending Fell Again in December
SUMMARY: Fresh data offered more detail on how shoppers retrenched at the end of 2022.

TITLE: A Closely Watched Measure of Inflation Slowed in December
SUMMARY: The Personal Consumption Expenditures price index climbed 5 percent from a year earlier, slower than the reading last month.

TITLE: Elon Musk Meets With House Speaker Kevin McCarthy
SUMMARY: Elon Musk, the billionaire owner of Twitter, met with House Speaker Kevin McCarthy, stoking speculation about what the two had discussed.

TITLE: A Copper Mine Could Advance Green Energy but Scar Sacred Land
SUMMARY: Tribal groups are fighting an Arizona project whose backers say increasing the supply of copper, crucial to batteries, would reduce fossil-fuel use.

TITLE: Start-Up Paradigm Raises $200 Million to Speed Up Drug Trials
SUMMARY: New York-based Paradigm has raised a significant amount to simplify clinical trials. Its goal is ambitious, but its challenges are many, researchers say.

TITLE: He’s Dazzled Diners in the U.S. Now He Aims to ‘Change People’s Perspectives’ in Ivory Coast.
SUMMARY: The chef Roze Traore has spent years building a name for himself in New York, but for his new project, he’s tapping his family ties to West Africa.

TITLE: A Federal Court Blocks California’s New Medical Misinformation Law
SUMMARY: California’s law sought to punish doctors who give patients false information about Covid-19.

TITLE: FDA Seeks More Authority to Oversee CBD Products
SUMMARY: The agency wants Congress to intervene, saying it does not have adequate oversight powers to ensure the safety of the myriad cannabidiol products derived from hemp.

TITLE: Lloyd Morrisett, a Founder of ‘Sesame Street,’ Dies at 93
SUMMARY: His observations about his 3-year-old daughter’s viewing habits led him to join Joan Ganz Cooney in creating a program that revolutionized children’s television.

TITLE: Bed Bath & Beyond Says It Defaulted on Debt Payments
SUMMARY: The disclosure was the most salient sign of financial strain yet for the beleaguered retailer, which is exploring a possible bankruptcy filing.

TITLE: Help! I Reserved a Rental Car, but There Was No Car for Me.
SUMMARY: A reader’s reservation got her nowhere with Alamo (and Avis didn’t pull through either), raising the question of why rental companies have such a bad record of delivering the cars they promise.

TITLE: Stripe Hires Investment Banks to Explore Public Listing
SUMMARY: The payments processing start-up, one of the world’s most valuable private companies, could go public in the next year, people with knowledge of the matter said.

TITLE: Fireball Maker Is Sued Over Bottles That Don’t Contain Whisky
SUMMARY: An Illinois woman who wanted whisky, but got a cinnamon-and-whisky-flavored malt beverage instead, has sued the maker of Fireball for fraud.

TITLE: How Do Heavy Metals Like Lead Get in Baby Food?
SUMMARY: The problem begins at the farm where plants draw toxins from the soil. There’s no washing them away.

TITLE: Two Former Arkansas Officers Are Charged Over Beating Captured on Video
SUMMARY: The sheriff’s deputies used “excessive force” during the arrest of a man last year, the U.S. Justice Department said. The encounter was shared widely on social media.

TITLE: Biden Hammers Republicans on the Economy, With Eye on 2024
SUMMARY: The president has found a welcome foil in a new conservative House majority and its tax and spending plans, sharpening a potential re-election message.

TITLE: Dotdash Meredith, Publisher of People and InStyle, Cuts 7% of Staff
SUMMARY: The layoffs will affect 274 people, the company said.

TITLE: Toyota Names a New CEO as Akio Toyoda Steps Aside
SUMMARY: Akio Toyoda, who has been reluctant to embrace all-electric vehicles, will be succeeded as C.E.O. by a Lexus executive.

TITLE: Chipotle Beefs Up Hiring Ahead of ‘Burrito Season’
SUMMARY: The restaurant chain is pitching for more workers as it aims to double the number of outlets in North America.

TITLE: With Layoffs, Retailers Aim to Be Safe Rather Than Sorry (Again)
SUMMARY: Companies that ramped up hiring in areas like technology over the past few years are cutting back as customers slow their spending.

TITLE: Southwest Lost $220 Million Because of Holiday Meltdown
SUMMARY: The airline, which canceled 16,700 flights before and after Christmas, said it lost $220 million in the last three months of the year.

TITLE: Tesla Bulls Take Heart From Strong Profits
SUMMARY: Shares in the electric carmaker continued to rally after the company reported strong profits, even amid growing competition and economic pressures.

TITLE: U.S. Economy Grew at 2.9% Annual Rate in Fourth Quarter
SUMMARY: The continued growth in the fourth quarter showed the resilience of consumers and businesses in the face of inflation and rising interest rates.

TITLE: Why The Times Is Resuming its Emphasis on Annualized Figures for GDP
SUMMARY: The pandemic shock is no longer producing exceptional economic gyrations.

TITLE: Sundance, Once a Hotbed for Film Deals, Tries to Find Its Footing
SUMMARY: The kind of independent movies that the festival showcases have struggled at the box office, spurring worries about what the market would be like this year.

TITLE: Judge Orders Release of Video Showing Attack on Paul Pelosi
SUMMARY: There was no reason to keep the footage secret, Judge Stephen M. Murphy of San Francisco Superior Court ruled. It could be released as soon as Thursday.

TITLE: IBM Announces 3,900 Job Cuts
SUMMARY: The company said the layoffs were a final step after asset sales rather than a sign of weakness in its business.

TITLE: House Passes Bill to Study FAA Alert System Whose Outage Grounded Flights
SUMMARY: The outage caused departures nationwide to be halted one morning this month, disrupting travel and drawing attention to the Federal Aviation Administration’s outdated technology.

TITLE: Meta to Reinstate Trump’s Facebook and Instagram Accounts
SUMMARY: Meta said the suspensions of Donald Trump’s accounts would be lifted “in the coming weeks,” with measures in place to discourage repeat offenses. Twitter reinstated Mr. Trump last year.

TITLE: Tesla’s Profit Jumped 12% in Fourth Quarter
SUMMARY: The electric car company is facing intensifying competition, supply chain disruptions and concerns about the behavior of Elon Musk.

TITLE: Kohl’s Closing In on Naming Permanent C.E.O.
SUMMARY: Tom Kingsbury, the interim chief executive, is in late-stage talks to replace Michelle Gass, who left the retailer to join Levi’s last year.

TITLE: Myrtle Witbooi, Who Fought for Domestic Workers’ Rights, Dies at 75
SUMMARY: She experienced the inequities of the job firsthand in South Africa and helped build national and international unions to address them.

TITLE: The Times Asks Judge to Unseal Documents in Fox News Defamation Case
SUMMARY: Most of the evidence in the case has remained under seal at the request of Fox’s lawyers.

TITLE: California Voters to Decide on Regulating Fast-Food Industry
SUMMARY: Pre-empting a law signed last year, business groups forced a ballot initiative on state oversight of wages and working conditions.

TITLE: A Short Seller, Hindenburg Research, Bets Against Adani Group
SUMMARY: Hindenburg Research accused the Adani Group of orchestrating the “largest con in corporate history,”  sending shares of its companies tumbling on Wednesday.

TITLE: The Newest Contraband at the Mexican Border: Eggs
SUMMARY: There has been an increase in the number of people trying to bring eggs into the United States, where the price has surged, driven in part by a bird flu outbreak.

TITLE: Microsoft Outlook and Teams Are Back Online After Morning Outages
SUMMARY: The widely used Microsoft Teams and Outlook email services were unavailable for thousands of users early Wednesday.

TITLE: New Lawsuit Challenges State Bans on Abortion Pills
SUMMARY: The case, brought by GenBioPro, a company that makes one of two abortion drugs, argues that it is unconstitutional for a state to bar access to a medication approved by the federal government.

TITLE: Climate Change May Bring New Era of Trade Wars, as E.U. and U.S. Spar
SUMMARY: Countries are pursuing new solutions to try to mitigate climate change. More trade fights are likely to come hand in hand.

TITLE: Remote Workers Face a Lonely Wave of Layoffs
SUMMARY: Angst rippled across laptop screens this month, with dozens of companies announcing layoffs and finding ways to breed extra chaos in the process.
